metadata.synopsis: Ide mainly talks about the interaction the player can have with Rolan in his dialog (HAV_ProdigyLament_Rolan), where he berates the kid for not giving him more alcohol. This dialog continues that narrative beat, and players can acquire a book Ide was planning to give Rolan.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Load SCL levelDebugBook Act02 After CheckpointRecon : teleport S_DEN_Trainee_002Talk to Rolan and end the dialogue (Ide will flee)Find Ide again using teleport S_DEN_Trainee_002 in recon (she is in a room nearby)Interact with her

12.speaker: Ide
12.text: People just ran off and said nothing! Adults always do this.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: You mentioned you had a magic book?

87.speaker: Ide
87.text: The one for Rolan? What about it?

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Nothing important - I just want a drink.

1.speaker: Ide
1.text: My mum always said a drink's the most important meal of the day. Take your pick.
1.context: NodeContext: player asked for a drink and you're 'working' at a bar, in your childish way - after this dialogue ends, a trade window opens with your character so there's no pulling of pints or fetching of bottles.

27.speaker: Ide
27.text: What are you doing? You gotta get Mol. Don't make me regret trusting you with this.
27.context: NodeContext: Impatient out of concern. You're terrified for your friend.

33.speaker: Ide
33.text: If this is about Rolan, go away.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away from player, avoiding eye contactNodeContext: Upset frustrated

18.speaker: Ide
18.text: He acts like he wished we weren't here - like he wished he hadn't saved us.
18.context: NodeContext: Frustrated and upset. Hurt but tryiing not to show it. Could be mistaken for a bit bratty.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: But he did save you - that's what matters.

5.speaker: Ide
5.text: And now we're just trying to save him from drinking himself stupid!
5.context: NodeContext: excitable - this adult you're talking to really gets that you're doing a good thing

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Ignore him - he's more immature than you are.

14.speaker: Ide
14.text: Right? He went through three bottles before I told him to stop.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: All this whining is making me wish he hadn't saved you.

48.speaker: Ide
48.text: You're just as mean as the rest of 'em.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Ignore Rolan. He's just a grump.

4.speaker: Ide
4.text: He called me a 'ragged little devil'.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks upset.NodeContext: Frustrated and upset. Hurt but tryiing not to show it. Could be mistaken for a bit bratty.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: True. But I don't think he meant it.

92.speaker: Ide
92.text: Then he should say sorry - all I did was tell him he shouldn't drink anymore.
92.context: NodeContext: with attitude. Annoyed that the is player is here and rolan - who he feels should be apologising.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Very observant of him - that's exactly what you are.

58.speaker: Ide
58.text: Yeah, well everyone says you smell like rotting badger, but they're wrong.
58.context: NodeContext: Bratty and impetulant. You're about to deliver a sick burn.

68.speaker: Ide
68.text: You smell like crusty toe-jam - look it too. Bye.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Next time, call him one back.

83.speaker: Ide
83.context: NodeContext: laughing at the thought. Chilish and excited

24.speaker: Player
24.text: No need to snap at me.

74.speaker: Ide
74.text: ...Sorry. Rolan snapped too and I didn't like it.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I don't blame him - he wanted a drink, and you wouldn't serve him.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Rolan isn't very good with kids.

0.speaker: Ide
0.text: He isn't very good with anyone. He yelled at me just because I told him not to drink anymore.

95.speaker: Ide
95.text: It was for his own good! He can barely stand up straight.
95.context: NodeContext: your voice could be mistake for petulance but you're just hurt and frustrated.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I get it - you were trying to look after him.

63.speaker: Ide
63.text: Yeah. He did save us, after all.
63.context: NodeContext: Kind of awkward and bashful about it

38.speaker: Player
38.text: What do you mean, his loss?

41.speaker: Ide
41.text: I found this book. Old, dusty, full of strange lettering. Pretty sure it's magic.

94.speaker: Ide
94.text: I was gonna give it to Rolan so he could learn new spells, you know? Beats drinking 'til he forgets the ones he knows.
94.context: NodeContext: a little downcast - you were trying to make a gesture and you feel it's been trodden on

93.speaker: Player
93.text: If you give it to me, I'll make sure he gets it.

10.speaker: Ide
10.text: Fine. Here, you ... huh, where is it?
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reaching behind back for the book to find it missing. Looking around - confused. NodeContext: You can't find the book on your person. You're looking around confused.

2.speaker: Ide
2.text: I musta dropped it. Well, you can look for it if you want.
2.context: NodeContext: Nonchalant - it's not your problem.

70.speaker: Ide
70.text: Anyway, I'm sick of talking. You can go now. Bye-bye.
70.context: NodeContext: Shrug and nonchalant as you end the convo

23.speaker: Ide
23.text: Fine. He'll probably hate it anyway. Here.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back for item from inventory - hands book to playerNodeContext: Dramatic sigh. Kind of bratty.

85.speaker: Ide
85.text: Uh-huh. Like I've never used that one before.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rolls eyes. NodeContext: Rolls eyes. With attitude.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Give it to me, you brat. Now.

75.speaker: Ide
75.text: Sorry. I didn't mean - here. Just go away!
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back for item from inventory - hands book to playerNodeContext: Tense afraid.

73.speaker: Ide
73.text: Brat? Really? You can do better than that.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Do you really want to give it to him after how he acted?

47.speaker: Ide
47.text: Guess you can have it then. I don't care.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back for item from inventory - hands book to playerNodeContext: You absolutely care

42.speaker: Ide
42.text: True. Guess I'll keep it then.
42.context: NodeContext: With attitude - you know exactly what the player was trying to pull.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Why don't you keep it for yourself?

29.speaker: Ide
29.context: NodeContext: Unsure about the gift you picked out. Doubting yourself.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: That's a great gift. I'm sure he'll love it.

67.speaker: Ide
67.text: Maybe. Thanks for... talking and stuff.
67.context: NodeContext: Bashful. Pleased that  grown up is praising him.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: He'll be losing his mind and his lunch if he keeps drinking like that.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: How about a drink for me, instead?

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I'm sure it is. See you around, kid.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: A drunk wizard's a dangerous thing - all that uncontrolled power.

72.speaker: Ide
72.text: Right? He might wave his arms wrong and burn the whole inn down, or belch up a puddle of acid.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: smirkingNodeContext: a smirk - enjoying ragging on an adult

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Stop interfering. Just stay out of his way - and mine.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Actually I just wanted a drink.

61.speaker: Ide
61.context: NodeContext: Sad - not quite sniffling back tears, more peeved

78.speaker: Ide
78.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.NodeContext: almost in tears

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I could use some supplies, if you've still got any.

6.speaker: Ide
6.context: NodeContext: Bashful. Pleased that  grown up is praising him.

81.speaker: Ide
81.text: I'll find out what's going on myself, thank you very much.

99.speaker: Ide
99.text: They took Mol - I couldn't stop them.
